summary: This is an FBI communication regarding the late submission of consensually monitored recordings involving Alfredo Rodriguez, Bradley Edwards, and an FBI Undercover Employee (UCE). The delay was due to the case agent preparing for and departing on a temporary duty assignment to Afghanistan.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: The subject of consensually monitored phone calls with Bradley Edwards and an FBI UCE, and the target of a takedown on November 3, 2009.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: Participated in consensually monitored phone calls with the subject, Alfredo Rodriguez.

persons.name: Betsy N. Colon
persons.context: The intended recipient of the communication and the submitted recordings from the Miami field office.

connections.description: Rodriguez was the subject of consensually monitored phone calls where Edwards was the complaining witness.
Rodriguez participated in consensually monitored phone calls with an FBI Undercover Employee as part of an investigation.

events.title: Takedown of Alfredo Rodriguez
events.description: Audio and video surveillance was conducted during the takedown (presumably arrest or apprehension) of Alfredo Rodriguez.

events.title: Late Submission of Recordings
events.description: An FBI communication explains the late submission of consensually monitored recordings and surveillance footage due to the case agent's deployment.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez was the subject of a takedown operation on November 3, 2009, which was captured on audio and video surveillance.
Consensually monitored phone calls occurred between Rodriguez and complaining witness Bradley Edwards, and between Rodriguez and an FBI Undercover Employee (UCE).
The submission of these recordings to ELSUR was delayed because the case agent was preparing for and left for a temporary duty assignment in Afghanistan.
The document is an internal FBI communication (likely a 302 or similar report) dated February 4, 2010, addressing an administrative delay in an obstruction case.
